name: WIPP Resnet50 Regression Plugin
title: Resnet50 Regression
author: Michael Majurski
institution: National Institute of Standards and Technology
citation: "Residual Learning for Image Recognition.", Kaiming He, Xiangyu Zhang, Shaoqing Ren, and Jian SunDeep, 10 Dec 2015. arXiv:1512.03385v1

inputs.name: image_folder
inputs.description: filepath to the folder containing the images.

inputs.name: csv_filepath
inputs.description: CSV collection of the file containing the ground truth labels.

inputs.name: csv_name
inputs.description: name to the file containing the ground truth labels. Csv file SHOULD NOT HAVE HEADERS!

inputs.name: batch_size
inputs.description: How many images/tiles to use per mini-batch. The number of images used to estimate the gradient per training step. [default: 4]

inputs.name: learning_rate
inputs.description: What is the learning rate for the network? [default: 3e-4]

inputs.name: test_every_n_steps
inputs.description: This controls how big the effective epoch is. It enables controlling the test frequency between experiments with different true epoch sizes. [default: 1000]

inputs.name: use_augmentation
inputs.description: Whether or not to use data augmentation during training.

inputs.name: early_stopping
inputs.description: Perform early stopping when the test loss does not improve for N epochs.

inputs.name: reader_count
inputs.description: how many threads to use for disk I/O and augmentation per gpu.

outputs.name: tensorboard_folder
outputs.description: tensorboard Logs data for the plugin

ui.title: Batch Size:
ui.description: How many images/tiles to use per mini-batch?

ui.title: Test Every N Steps:
ui.description: How many gradient update (training) steps to take between test split evaluations.

ui.title: Early Stopping Value:
ui.description: Stopping when the test loss does not improve for ... epochs

ui.title: Reader Count:
ui.description: How many threads to use for disk I/O and augmentation per gpu.
